main event: On April 8, 1949, in Los Angeles, California, three witnesses reported seeing a disc-shaped, aluminum-colored object flying at high altitude with no sound or odor, leaving a very thin dark trail which dissipated immediately.
interesting points: The object reflected the sun's rays and appeared to have many projections from it.
One witness described the object as rotating, while another disagreed and stated it appeared to be turning over and over like a flipped coin.
The object was estimated to be about half the size of a 10¢ coin when held at arm's length.
It was observed traveling at a high speed, faster than a jet, and covered a 160° arc in approximately 35 seconds.
No military or civilian aircraft were scheduled in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
witnesses: City employee, laborer, and a Mexican laborer
